item.description: Books that I’m currently reading 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 TABLE title, rating, author, status FROM "reading/books" WHERE status = "Currently reading" SORT rating DESC
Books that I’m paused on 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 TABLE title as "Title", genre_1 as "Genre 1", rating AS "Rating" FROM "reading/books" WHERE status = "Paused" SORT rating DESC
What are the four main features that make a language a language? Duality of patterning Arbitrariness of the sign Reflexivity Displacement What is duality of patterning?
What are lists in python? [a, b, c] same as an array. Ordered. Mutable. What are tuples in python? (a, b, c) functions like a list but immutable.

What are independent and dependent variables? role of the variables classical name better name thing to be explained dependent variable outcome thing doing the explaining independent variable predictor What is a confound?

What are the 4 scales of measurement? Nominal scale - categories without hierarchy or order (e.g. eye color) Ordinal scale - categories with an order (think groupings of opinion from supportive to hostile of vaccines) Interval scale - ratios hold up and averages can be done, but the zero point is arbitrary so while addition and subtraction are meaningful, and thus so are means, multiplication and division can’t be done with meaning (think temperatures - zero degrees Celsius is not the absence of temperature it’s just an arbitrary point at which water freezes.

item.title: Autonomous
item.description: ![[newitz_autonomous.jpeg|200]] An excellent [[Science Fiction]] novel by [[Annalee Newitz]]

item.title: Effective maps
item.description: You can’t measure the effectiveness of a map based on its resolution or how well it was constructed. These are useful things to know, but the effectiveness of maps is measured based on where you want to go.

item.title: Hundreds of examples beats millions of words
item.description: The most powerful levels of expertise are beyond the conscious mind, intuition that often can’t be explained. Because of this the best way to teach is with high quality, high quantity examples.

item.title: Organizational objectives should be unique to an organization
item.description: “Build a delightful product”? That’s vague to the point of being meaningless. No company does not want to build a delightful product, it’s safe to assume everybody has that goal as a base level.

item.title: Plan systems on a weekly time horizon
item.description: There’s an unresolvable tension between two poles: integration, completeness, complexity modularity, focus, simplicity When building tools or systems it’s really easy to start getting knotted up in your own threads trying to weave a solution that satisfies (impossibly), both of these poles.

item.title: Split skills into chunks and move them to expertise quickly
item.description: The appropriate size of skill is something you can move from new knowledge to mastered in 3 x 45-90 min sessions.

item.title: Structure, not process
item.description: Structure is what, when, where, why, and how to do a thing. For example, proposals go in a certain Notion database, they use a specific template, they require certain metadata.
